page.title: 04INCHBRAKIE CASTLE 1
page.content: The only positive remains of {Inchbrakie Castle}is the moat which encircles a mound covered in fir trees and rhododendrons, also a few large boulders which we think, due to their regular shape, could have been part of the castle walls. Perhaps Inchbrakie no longer stands because of its connection with {Kate MacNiven,}(the last{witch}to be burned in Crieff, at the Knock.) The story goes that the laird of Inchbrakie lost his knife and fork whilst being distracted by a bee. He put down his cutlery to ward off the bee and when he turned his attention back to his dinner they were gone. After a great search they could not be found. When he got home Kate MacNiven had found them. This led to the belief that she had changed into a bee and had stolen the knife and fork.
